intro: Epirizanthe, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Epirizanthe is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. Its blooming period occurs in the spring and early summer, adding a vibrant touch to the landscape.
